content: Jeff Hawkins' 'Thousand Brains Theory' is one of the most compelling answers to how the 3mm-thick sheet of cells on the surface of our brain gives rise to human intelligence.
The 'Thousand Brains Theory' proposes that every cortical column in the brain functions as a complete sensorimotor system, contributing to human intelligence.

The neurobiology of cortical columns involves six neuronal layers of the cortex working together to build predictive models of the world through a constant loop of sensation, movement, and consensus voting.
